meanings.definition: A thing that fails to work properly or is otherwise unsatisfactory.
meanings.sent1: The toy I bought turned out to be a dud.
meanings.sent2: The firework was a dud and didn't explode as expected.
meanings.sent3: I tried to use the old phone, but it was a dud and wouldn't even turn on.
meanings.sent4: The plan to surprise her was a dud, just like a deflated balloon.
meanings.sent5: The dud computer sat in the corner, useless and broken.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that proves to be a failure.
meanings.sent1: The new employee turned out to be a dud and couldn't handle the job.
meanings.sent2: The project was a dud due to poor planning.
meanings.sent3: The party was a dud when the music system broke down.
meanings.sent4: The dud of a car broke down on the highway, causing a delay.
meanings.sent5: The movie was a dud with terrible acting and a weak plot.

meanings.definition: To fail to work properly; be unsatisfactory.
meanings.sent1: The engine dud when I tried to start the lawn mower.
meanings.sent2: The plan dud, leaving us stranded in the middle of nowhere.
meanings.sent3: His attempt to fix the leaky faucet dud, making it worse.
meanings.sent4: The apology dud as he failed to express genuine remorse.
meanings.sent5: The new software update dud, causing more glitches than before.
